DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate that heated, humidified, high-flow nasal cannula (HHHFNC) is superior to hypertonic saline solution (HSS) in the treatment of moderate acute viral bronchiolitis in infants in improving respiratory distress and comfort and reducing length of hospital stay (LOS) and admission to Pediatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU).
DOC.brief_title: High Flow Therapy vs Hypertonic Saline in Bronchiolitis
DOC.criteria: Children aged 6 months or less Moderate (Respiratory Distress Assessment Instrument score of 4 or greater) viral bronchiolitis (as defined by McConnockie) Meeting Admission criteria History of prematurity Chronic lung disease Cystic fibrosis Congenital heart disease Neuromuscular disease Airway anomalies Immunodeficiency Those requiring immediate intubation and ventilation.
